floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Stafford river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall overnight and this morning, Saturday 08/05/2021. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected to begin this morning, Saturday 08/05/21. Flooding is expected to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, with unsettled conditions forecast to continue over the coming days.
Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 09/05/21, or as the situation changes.
